availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Braxton Lisle (Clark County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier, 11, 7, 2nd Ky CSA Cav)

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John E. Lisle and Mary Lisle. Student in Clark County in 1850. Farmer in Clark County in 1860. Served in Company A, 11th Kentucky Cavalry (C.S.A.) as a private from September 10, 1862, to July 1, 1863. Served in Company A, 7th Kentucky Cavalry, (C.S.A) as a private from July 1, 1863, to June 30, 1864. Captured on Morgan's Raid in Chester, Ohio, on July 19, 1863. Prisoner in Cincinnati, Ohio, from July 19, 1863 to August 20, 1863. Prisoner at Camp Chase, Ohio, on August 26, 1863. Escaped from Camp Douglas, Chicago, Illinois. Served in Company A, 2nd Battalion Kentucky Cavalry (C.S.A) as a private from August 16, 1864 to December 12, 1864. Captured in Rogersville, Tennessee. Prisoner in Knoxville, Tennessee, in December 1864. Prisoner in Nashville, Tennessee, on January 8, 1865. Prisoner in the Military Prison, Louisville, Kentucky, from January 8, 1865 to January 14, 1865. Prisoner at Camp Chase, Ohio, from January 14, 1865 to May 15, 1865. Took the Oath of Allegiance in Camp Chase, Ohio, on May 15, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 2, p. 12B.
